page.title: 08A Hellifield Farm
page.content: Tenley Farm, lies near to the A65 Keighley to Kendal trunk road about a mile from the village of Hellifield. It once formed part of the Tenley Estate which covered many acres of land around Peel Castle at Hellifield, and lies adjacent to Peel Wood. The farm is situated in the Craven District which is a grassland area where livestock is kept for dairy, beef and lamb production. Tenley Farm now covers 94 acres together with 170 acres of offlying land which carries 320 lambing sheep, producing 600 lambs and 140 beef cattle which are reared from calves.The fat lambs and cattle are sold at Hellifield Auction Mart. Silage is made in June, and then a second crop is obtained in August for feeding to the cattle kept inside in winter. Hay , harvested in July, is used for winter feed for the sheep.
